header_summary: N-bit claims and their validation using NAND circuits are discussed, with an example of a 4-bit claim and the prover/challenger model. A draft BIP update is mentioned, including a proposed reference implementation and a caching strategy implementation on GitHub. Two solutions for ensuring lack of equivocation in off-chain state are proposed, along with the use of fidelity bonds and a coordinator. SimLN, a tool for simulating random payment activity on test lightning network setups, is introduced. A discussion about decorrelated payments and a research write-up is mentioned, along with a correction of a previous link.

recent_posts.title: BitVM: Compute Anything on Bitcoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses N-bit claims and the use of NAND circuits for validation.
- A prover/challenger system is described, where challenges are issued to verify solutions.
- The email explores optimizations and challenges in implementing this approach using tapleafs.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
recent_posts.summary:
- Steven Roose provides an update to the draft BIP, including a proposed reference implementation.
- The reference implementation demonstrates achieving TXHASH with clear upper limits on hashed bytes.
- The email includes links to the draft BIP and a cache implementation on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the issue of ensuring lack of equivocation in an off-chain state.
- Two possible solutions are suggested: updating balance keys or designing a fraud-proof system.
- Fidelity bonds, equal to initial balance multiplied by remaining counterparties, can prevent equivocation.

recent_posts.title: SimLN: Simulate active test networks
recent_posts.summary:
- SimLN is a tool for simulating random payment activity on lightning network setups.
- It allows for configurable payment flows and testing against "busy" networks.
- SimLN automates payment generation, saves time, and offers integration into development environments.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs and Tony are discussing the concept of decorrelated payments and its potential benefits.
- Gijs refers to the concept as a step up from PTLCs and additional timing analysis protections.
- Gijs asks Tony if he sees the possibility of using this concept based on their previous research.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- Simple covenants with CTV or APO can create Lightning channels for casual users.
- Changing consensus rules to allow covenants eliminates the need for user signatures.
- Timeout-trees and FFO-WF protocol can improve Lightning scalability and usability.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The code includes OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and introduces an additional 'flags' parameter.
- The new OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY opcode allows for fraud proofs and full generality of MATT.

active_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses interactivity constraints in payment pools and channel factories, specifically regarding off-chain balances.
- Proposed solutions include introducing a coordinator or partitioning balances among users subsets.
- The author suggests preventing off-chain group equivocation by using cut-through spends to update leaves.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes solutions to scale Lightning and create channels for casual users.
- Enabling simple covenants and implementing timeout-trees can greatly improve Lightning's scalability.
- The protocols mentioned in the email enable off-chain Lightning transactions and address usability concerns.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document a concept for securely sending commands to a lightning node using an HSM.
- The architecture requires minimal changes to the lightning node and can be implemented on a Ledger Nano S.
- Bastien offers to provide specifications, review the implementation, and suggests open-source grant funding.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg emphasizes the importance of PTLCs as taproot channels are about to be deployed.
- He has shared a comprehensive summary on GitHub, exploring various aspects of PTLCs.
- Greg invites feedback and suggests initiating a standardization effort for PTLCs.
